Articles.Content:
Hey,

Sorry if this is posted somewhere else. So, I am having a problem with interplanetary orbits. When I leave Kerbin's sphere of influence my orbit drastically changes from relative to the sun and I am no longer on an intercept, sometimes over 1000 delta v off of my intercept with a target. Is there any way to correct for this?

This is when I leave orbit around Kerbin:

http://imgur.com/uMu7CbS

And this is when I enter into the Sun's:

http://imgur.com/0jp5bp1

Thanks

Edited January 22, 2015 by Vesem
Tag Change

Slow down the time warp before going through the SOI boundary between Kerbin and Sun. Ideally you'll be wanting to go at normal or 5x warp. 10x or 50x usually isn't bad, but 100x or more can get catastrophic.

I see you have Kerbal Alarm Clock installed. I'd suggest turning on automatic SOI change alarms. Just have them slow down time and alert, no need to pause.
Ah, cool. Thanks. I just set that up.
